declarations.comments:
`Biapplicative` captures type constructors of two arguments which support lifting of
functions of zero or more arguments, in the sense of `Applicative`.
declarations.title: Biapplicative

declarations.comments:
A convenience operator which can be used to apply the result of `bipure` in
the style of `Applicative`:

```purescript
bipure f g <<$>> x <<*>> y
```

`Biapply` captures type constructors of two arguments which support lifting of
functions of one or more arguments, in the sense of `Apply`.
declarations.title: Biapply

declarations.comments: Keep the results of the second computation.
declarations.title: biapplyFirst

declarations.comments: Keep the results of the first computation.
declarations.title: biapplySecond

declarations.comments: Lift a function of two arguments.
declarations.title: bilift2

declarations.comments: Lift a function of three arguments.
declarations.title: bilift3

declarations.comments:
A `Bifunctor` is a `Functor` from the pair category `(Type, Type)` to `Type`.

A type constructor with two type arguments can be made into a `Bifunctor` if
both of its type arguments are covariant.

The `bimap` function maps a pair of functions over the two type arguments
of the bifunctor.

Laws:

- Identity: `bimap identity identity == identity`
- Composition: `bimap f1 g1 <<< bimap f2 g2 == bimap (f1 <<< f2) (g1 <<< g2)`
declarations.title: Bifunctor

declarations.comments: Map a function over the first type argument of a `Bifunctor`.
declarations.title: lmap

declarations.comments: Map a function over the second type arguments of a `Bifunctor`.
declarations.title: rmap

declarations.comments: Make a `Functor` over the first argument of a `Bifunctor`
declarations.title: Clown

declarations.comments: Flips the order of the type arguments of a `Bifunctor`.
declarations.title: Flip

declarations.comments: Turns a `Bifunctor` into a `Functor` by equating the two type arguments.
declarations.title: Join

declarations.comments: Make a `Functor` over the second argument of a `Bifunctor`
declarations.title: Joker

declarations.comments: Provides a `Functor` over the second argument of a `Bifunctor`.
declarations.title: Wrap
